About Me Projects

Hello, I'm Ali.

I’m a software developer. I recently relocated to San Francisco from living in England the past three years. My background is in the arts, politics and economics. I shifted over to technology after a year of learning to code in my spare time. I studied at General Assembly in London to learn about web development and design
I graduated with BA in Political Economy from UC Berkeley but I’m a video games-coffee-honey whisky type of dork. My friends call me Ali, Alis, or dudette. When I’m not online, you can find me hanging out with friends outside or even cooking
Whatever I’m up to, one thing is for sure, I love life and I'm usually up for a laugh. Want to work together? I’d love to hear from you

Projects

Wandergo. A travel app built with Ionic 1 and AngularJS. Main objective was for user to be able to login via Facebook, search and book flights via Momondo’s API, reserve hotels via Booking.com and also explore the destination city for activities and restaurants via Foursquare. I help leading this project with one of the lead developers from start to end

Check it out

Flowerbx. A flower delivery service in London built with Magento 2. Main objective was to maintain and debug across all capabilities, searching, favorites, payment and delivery methods, also update database and enhance design

Check it out

Horse Scout A Wordpress site for equestrian enthusiasts in the South of England where they can upload photos to buy and sell their horses. My main responsibility was to debug as issues came up, ensure forms were submitting the data properly and uploading new content when needed

Check it out

Dealbuyer An e-commerce site built with Magento 1. My responsibilities included working along the lead developer to set up servers and configuring extension modules. I also managed the project by organizing timeliness for the different stages of the project

Check it out
